sentence.Network_en: Some excerpts from a Renaissance mass are spatchcocked into Gluck's pallid Don Juan music.
sentence.Network_cn: 一些文艺复光时期的弥撒的选节被不适当地加入到了格鲁克平淡无味的唐璜音乐中.

sentence.Network_en: The moon drifted from behind the clouds and exposed the pallid face.
sentence.Network_cn: 月亮从云朵后面钻出来,照着尸体那张苍白的脸.

sentence.Network_en: Their condition ranged from pallid shock to profane defiance.
sentence.Network_cn: 有的吓得脸无人色,有的天不怕地不怕.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 所有形容人的形容词的英文拼写_百度知道 ... Protruding 凸出的 Pallid 苍白的 Bushy 浓密的.
苍_百度百科 ... 灰白色〖 ashy;gray〗 苍白〖 pale;ashy;pallid〗 苍苍〖 ashy;pale;gray;ashen〗.
英文单词有关虚弱_百度知道 ... miasma n. 不健康的环境或影响；瘴气 pallid adj. 苍白的，没血色的 debilitate v. 使衰弱.
徐绽的学生_新浪博客 ... palliation n. 掩饰, 辩解, 辩解词; 缓和, 减缓, 减缓物 pallid a. 苍白的, 病状的 fingernail n. 指甲.

list.abs: his pallid skin was sensitive to the glaring sun ., 他苍白的皮肤对耀眼的阳光很敏感.
Delivers you a pallid to gather , hundred years good and count on it ., 送你一扎百合 , 百年好合指望它.
so that a blue and pallid people ., 因此 , 那些忧郁而苍白的人们.
my orange rocket standing out against a pallid sky ., 我的橙色火箭常委会对一苍白的天空.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 16th cent.: from Latin pallidus 'pale' (related to pallere 'be pale')

entry.tran: 苍白的；无血色的；暗淡的
entry.def: Someone or something that  is pallid is pale in an unattractive or unnatural way.

example.tran: 苍白面孔上无助的忧伤

entry.tran: （演出、书籍等）平淡的，乏味的，了无生气的
entry.def: You can describe something such as a performance or book as pallid if it is weak or not at all exciting.

example.ex: ...a pallid account of the future of transport.
example.tran: 对交通运输前景的平淡描述

means.word_mean: 1. abnormally deficient in color as suggesting physical or emotional distress;
2. (of light) lacking in intensity or brightness; dim or feeble;

sentences.sentence: "the pale light of a half moon"
"the late afternoon light coming through the el tracks fell in pale oblongs on the street"

means.word_mean: 3. lacking in vitality or interest or effectiveness;

sentences.sentence: "pale prose with the faint sweetness of lavender"

auth_sentence.content: Splotches of angry red appeared on his pallid cheeks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Splotches of angry red appeared on his pallid cheeks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Splotches of angry red appeared on his pallid cheeks.

auth_sentence.content: We were pallid creatures, after so long indoors.
auth_sentence.res_content: We were pallid creatures, after so long indoors.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We were pallid creatures, after so long indoors.

auth_sentence.content: He was pallid and not prepossessing, with...a flattish Slav nose.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was pallid and not prepossessing, with...a flattish Slav nose.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was pallid and not prepossessing, with...a flattish Slav nose.
